newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Iran renews fuel oil contract with Singapore firms.
newsitem.headline: Iran renews fuel oil contract with Singapore firms.

text.p: National Iranian Oil Co (NIOC) has renewed its annual fuel oil term sale contracts with two Singapore companies, Hin Leong Trading and Kuo International for 1997/1998, an NIOC official said on Tuesday.
Under the contract for March 1997 to February 1998 liftings, Hin Leong will take four cargoes and Kuo two cargoes per month, he said.
Each cargo is between 75,000 and 90,000 tonnes.
Iran sells 280-centistoke grade fuel oil during summer which lasts between mid-March and mid-November and the 180-centistoke grade during the winter months of December to early March.
Trade sources said the price was at a discount of between $2.00 and $3.00 per tonne to MidEast spot quotes, free-on-board (fob) basis.
However, NIOC has not renewed its term sale contract with another Singapore buyer, Singapore Petroleum Co (SPC), sources said.
